byline.contributor: Wai Moe reported from Yangon, and Richard C. Paddock from Bangkok.
byline.original: By WAI MOE and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

abstract: Myanmar's parliament passes measure that would allow leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi to become 'state counselor,' role with powers exceeding that of president, after military leaders block her presidential bid; measure will proceed to desk of Pres Htin Kyaw, ally of Aung San Suu Kyi.
lead_paragraph: Some members of Parliament denounced the measure, which could give her authority exceeding the president’s, as an unconstitutional power grab.

headline.main: Aung San Suu Kyi Moves Closer to Leading Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Aung San Suu Kyi Moves Closer to Leading Myanmar

snippet: Some members of Parliament denounced the measure, which could give her authority exceeding the president’s, as an unconstitutional power grab.
